segments.text: I'm just utterly amazed by how many things are happening at once here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: First, there's the sink, just flowing like a miniature waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is cascading over the edge onto the counter and floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the woman, bless her heart, is completely focused on a plate, unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's astounding how oblivious she is to the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then I look over and see the kids staging their own little heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that wobbly stool, reaching for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm surprised the stool hasn't tipped over yet; it looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl is right there, ready for her share of the spoils.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s like three different plays are happening on the same stage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the outside garden and this indoor chaos is just incredible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I've never seen such a perfect storm of domestic obliviousness and mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder if she'll ever notice any of it.
segments.speaker: PAR
